intro: Oritrophium hirtopilosum, commonly known as the hairy bristly hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets. Oritrophium hirtopilosum is often found in the central and western United States.
